intro: Sida montana f. regnellii, commonly known as the redleaf sida, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and a distinctive reddish hue on the underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or open woodlands.
